Installation Guide

Install OpenClaw

Get your self-hosted AI gateway running in under 5 minutes. Works on macOS, Linux, and Windows (WSL2).

On This Page
  • What is OpenClaw?
  • System Requirements
  • Installation Steps
  • FAQ

What is OpenClaw?

OpenClaw is a self-hosted AI gateway ‚Äî a Node.js process you run on your own machine or server that acts as the brain connecting your chat apps (Telegram, WhatsApp, Discord, iMessage) to AI agents powered by models like Claude, GPT-4, or any OpenAI-compatible API. Instead of paying for multiple AI chatbot subscriptions that don't know each other, you run one gateway that serves all your channels simultaneously.

The key insight: your AI assistant should be reachable from wherever you are, on whatever device you have. OpenClaw makes that possible without surrendering your data to a third-party cloud service.

üí°
Open Source & MIT Licensed ‚Äî The full source code is available on GitHub. You can inspect it, modify it, and contribute back to the community.

System Requirements

üü¢
Node.js
v22 or later
Use node --version to check
üîë
API Key
Anthropic recommended
OpenAI-compatible APIs also work
üíª
OS
macOS / Linux / WSL2
Native Windows via WSL2
üåê
npm
Bundled with Node.js
v9+ recommended

Don't have Node.js 22? Install it via nvm: 

curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.7/install.sh | bash
nvm install 22
nvm use 22

Installation Steps

1

Install OpenClaw globally

npm install -g openclaw@latest

This installs the openclaw CLI globally. After it completes, verify with:

openclaw --version
2

Run the onboarding wizard

openclaw onboard --install-daemon

The wizard will ask you to:

  • Choose your AI provider (Anthropic / OpenAI / OpenRouter)
  • Enter your API key
  • Set a workspace directory (default: ~/.openclaw/workspace)
  • Install the background daemon service (so OpenClaw starts on boot)
üí° Tip: Get an Anthropic API key at console.anthropic.com. New accounts get $5 free credits ‚Äî more than enough to get started.
3

Connect your first channel

openclaw channels login

This opens an interactive menu to connect WhatsApp, Telegram, Discord, or other supported channels. For Telegram, you'll need a bot token ‚Äî see the Telegram guide for details.

4

Start the Gateway

openclaw gateway --port 18789

The gateway starts and prints the local dashboard URL:

‚úî Gateway running at http://127.0.0.1:18789/
‚úî Telegram: connected
‚úî Agent: Pi (Claude 3.5 Sonnet)

Open http://127.0.0.1:18789/ in your browser to see the Control UI.

5

Send your first message

Go to your connected chat app (Telegram, WhatsApp, etc.) and send a message. Your AI should respond within a few seconds. Try saying: 

Hello! What can you do for me?
‚úÖ You're live! If you get a response, your OpenClaw gateway is working perfectly.

FAQ

Does OpenClaw work on Windows without WSL? ‚ñº

OpenClaw requires a Unix-like environment. On Windows, you'll need WSL2 (Windows Subsystem for Linux). Install WSL2 by running wsl --install in an admin PowerShell, then install Node.js inside your WSL environment. The experience is identical to Linux once WSL2 is set up.

Which AI provider should I use? ‚ñº

Anthropic (Claude) is recommended for the best experience ‚Äî Claude models are particularly good at following complex system prompts, using tools, and maintaining context. Claude 3.5 Sonnet offers an excellent balance of capability and cost. That said, OpenClaw also works with OpenAI GPT-4o, and any OpenRouter model.

What's the difference between the daemon and manually running the gateway? ‚ñº

The daemon (installed via --install-daemon) registers OpenClaw as a system service that starts automatically on boot and restarts if it crashes. Manually running openclaw gateway works fine for testing but stops when you close the terminal. For production use (24/7 availability), always use the daemon.

Can I run OpenClaw on a VPS or cloud server? ‚ñº

Absolutely ‚Äî this is a great setup. A $5‚Äì10/month VPS (DigitalOcean, Hetzner, Linode) running Ubuntu works perfectly. The daemon approach is especially useful here. For remote access to the Control UI, OpenClaw supports Tailscale integration to expose the dashboard securely without opening ports.

How do I update OpenClaw? ‚ñº

Run the same install command to get the latest version: 

npm install -g openclaw@latest

Then restart the daemon:

openclaw gateway restart
